info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 12:37PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Spartanburg and Cherokee Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Spartanburg, or near Cowpens, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Spartanburg, Cowpens, Blacksburg, Mayo, Pacolet Mills, Grover, Croft State Park, USC Upstate and Cedar Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
